info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Jefferson County through 130 PM CDT... At 1257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bluff Park, or near Homewood. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Birmingham, Hoover, Vestavia Hills, Bessemer, Homewood, Mountain Brook, Fairfield, Midfield, Brighton, Lipscomb, Patton Creek, Hoover Metropolitan Stadium, Ross Bridge, Bluff Park, Riverchase Galleria, Samford University, Birmingham Zoo, Shannon and Lake Cyrus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Birmingham.
